segments.pli: “Tīhi, bhikkhave, ṭhānehi uttarakurukā manussā deve ca tāvatiṃse adhiggaṇhanti jambudīpake ca manusse.
segments.en: “The humans of Uttarakuru surpass the Gods of the Thirty-Three and the humans of India in three particulars.
They’re selfless and not possessive. They have a fixed life span. They have a distinctive nature.

segments.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi ṭhānehi uttarakurukā manussā deve ca tāvatiṃse adhiggaṇhanti jambudīpake ca manusse.
segments.en: The humans of Uttarakuru surpass the Gods of the Thirty-Three and the humans of India in these three particulars.

segments.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, ṭhānehi devā tāvatiṃsā uttarakuruke ca manusse adhiggaṇhanti jambudīpake ca manusse.
segments.en: The Gods of the Thirty-Three surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and India in three particulars.

segments.pli: Dibbena āyunā, dibbena vaṇṇena, dibbena sukhena—
segments.en: Divine life span, beauty, and happiness.

segments.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi ṭhānehi devā tāvatiṃsā uttarakuruke ca manusse adhiggaṇhanti jambudīpake ca manusse.
segments.en: The Gods of the Thirty-Three surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and India in these three particulars.

segments.pli: Tīhi, bhikkhave, ṭhānehi jambudīpakā manussā uttarakuruke ca manusse adhiggaṇhanti deve ca tāvatiṃse.
segments.en: The humans of India surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and the Gods of the Thirty-Three in three particulars.
Bravery, mindfulness, and the spiritual life is lived here.

segments.pli: imehi kho, bhikkhave, tīhi ṭhānehi jambudīpakā manussā uttarakuruke ca manusse adhiggaṇhanti deve ca tāvatiṃse”ti.
segments.en: The humans of India surpass the humans of Uttarakuru and the Gods of the Thirty-Three in these three particulars.”
